sen.j: 清閑寺家（せいかんじけ）は、名家 (公家)の家格を有する公家。
sen.e: Seikanji family was a kuge (court noble) with kakaku (family status) of meike (the fourth highest status for court nobles).
The Seikanji family were kuge (court nobles) with kakaku (family status) of meike (the fourth highest status for court nobles).
The Seikanji family were kuge (court nobles) with kakaku (family status) of meike (the fourth highest status for court nobles).
Kajuji line of the Northern House of the Fujiwara clan
They came under the Kajuji line of the Northern House of the Fujiwara clan
They came under the Kajuji line of the Northern House of the Fujiwara clan
Karoku (hereditary stipend) in the Edo Period was 180 koku (approx. 32.5 cubic meters).
Karoku (hereditary stipend) in the Edo Period was 180 koku (approx. 32.5 cubic meters).
Karoku (hereditary stipend) in the Edo Period was 180 koku (approx. 32.5 cubic meters).
After Meiji Restoration, count
After Meiji Restoration, they held the title of count
After the Meiji Restoration, they held the title of count.
sen.cmt: Meiji Restoration→the Meiji Restoration文末にピリオド

sen.j: 藤原高藤の後裔で、甘露寺経長の子、清閑寺資房によって創設された。
sen.e: This family was founded by Sukefusa SEIKANJI, who was descendant of FUJIWARA no Takafuji and a son of Tsunenaga KANROJI.
This family was founded by Sukefusa SEIKANJI, a descendant of FUJIWARA no Takafuji and the son of Tsunenaga KANROJI.
This family was founded by Sukefusa SEIKANJI, a descendant of FUJIWARA no Takafuji and the son of Tsunenaga KANROJI.

sen.j: 一時期中絶したが、江戸時代になって中御門資胤の子、清閑寺共房が入って相続した。
sen.e: This family was discontinued for a certain period, but, in the Edo Period, Tomofusa SEIKANJI, who was a son of Suketane NAKAMIKADO, inherited.
This family was discontinued for a certain period, but, during the Edo Period, Tomofusa SEIKANJI, who was the son of Suketane NAKAMIKADO, inherited it.
This family was discontinued for a certain period, but, during the Edo Period, Tomofusa SEIKANJI, who was the son of Suketane NAKAMIKADO, inherited it.

sen.j: 明治維新後の明治17年7月8日清閑寺盛房に伯爵の位を授けられた。
sen.e: After Meiji Restoration on July 8, 1884, the peerage of count was conferred on Morifusa SEIKANJI.
After the Meiji Restoration on July 8, 1884, the peerage of count was conferred on Morifusa SEIKANJI.
After the Meiji Restoration on July 8, 1884, the peerage of count was conferred on Morifusa SEIKANJI.
